meanings.definition: The action of freeing someone from an obligation or liability imposed on others.
meanings.sent1: The exemptions granted to the students allowed them to skip certain exams.
meanings.sent2: Tax exemptions are benefits that reduce the amount of tax owed by an individual or organization.
meanings.sent3: The exemptions from doing homework made the students cheer with joy.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was an exemption from the gloomy atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent5: The golden ticket served as an exemption to enter the exclusive event.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is excluded from a general rule or law.
meanings.sent1: The exemptions in the contract clearly stated who was not bound by the agreement.
meanings.sent2: The parking lot had designated spaces for disability exemptions.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat considered itself an exemption from the 'no pets allowed' rule.
meanings.sent4: His unique perspective was an exemption from the usual opinions shared in the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The rare flower stood out in the garden, an exemption among the common blooms.
